title: Use Log Rules
speech: Logarithm multiplication rule:  the log base a of b, plus the log base a of c is equal to the log base a of b c, .  the log base 3 of x plus the log base 3 of x is equal to the log base 3 of, parentheses x squared  is equal to 2

.   the log base 3 of x plus the log base 3 of x is equal to the log base 3 of,  x squared  is equal to 2

title: Turn the Constant into log
text: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get $$2=\log_{3}\left(9\right)$$ since $$3^2=9$$.
speech: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get  2 is equal to, the log base 3 of 9,  since  3 squared is equal to 9 .
pacedSpeech: Use the definition of logarithm, we can get   2 is equal to, the log base 3 of 9,

title: Match Bases
text: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes $$x^2=9$$. Solve for $$x$$ and get $$x=-3$$ or $$x=3$$.
speech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes  x squared is equal to, 9 . Solve for  x  and get  x is equal to, negative 3  or  x, is equal to 3 .
pacedSpeech: With all term containing same log base, the log can be removed, so it becomes   x squared is equal to, 9
and get   x is equal to, negative 3

title: Check for Constrains
text: Given $$\log_{a}\left(b\right)$$, $$b$$ can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get $$x=3$$ as the only solution for the equation.
speech: Given  the log base a of b, ,  b  can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get  x is equal to 3  as the only solution for the equation.

can not be negative. We can omit the negative answer and get   x is equal to 3
